intro: Oxydectes laniflora, commonly known as the woolly oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Oxydectes laniflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought-resistant qualities.
